vulnerability.name: Hidden Linux File
vulnerability.author: Thomas Shaw
vulnerability.description: Linux hidden file challenge. Creates a file containing a flag with a leading dot. e.g. '.secret_file'. Default behaviour is to drop the file in the root directory as '/.secret_file'. You can either supply an account or storage directory from the scenario, but not both. If an account is supplied, use '/home/username/.secret_file' If a storage directory is supplied, use '/path/to/storage_directory/.secret_file'
vulnerability.hint: Try reading the man page for ls with 'man ls'. Linux hidden files have names which begin with a dot. e.g. .file
vulnerability.solution: List all files in a directory including hidden files with 'ls -a [directory]'. Omit the [directory] to list those in the current working directory.
